selected_quotes: Who are the patients at high risk of #SleepApnea? See Am Acad of Sleep Medicine guidelines
Obesity, high blood pressure, diabetes, and a history of snoring, are all risk factors for sleep apnea -
@Hiway2health Training health care providers about sleep dysfunctions will improve the quality of lives of others.

citation.abstract: Obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) is a common chronic disorder that often requires lifelong care. Available practice parameters provide evidence-based recommendations for addressing aspects of care.
authors: Adult Obstructive Sleep Apnea Task Force of the American Academy of Sleep Medicine
citation.title: Clinical Guideline for the Evaluation, Management and Long-term Care of Obstructive Sleep Apnea in Adults
